screenplay.rawText:
EXT. STREETS OF SAN LUIS OBISPO - DAY
Jason Towne runs full-speed carrying a huge 48x60 painting. Sweating, panicked, weaving through downtown. Narration reflects regret and fear.
Fade to black.

lines: How could a commissioned painting get me here?
How did I let this happen?..

narrative.summary: Jason is fleeing with a large painting, terrified and sweating. His narration hints at a disastrous commission deal. The moment cuts abruptly to a flashback.
narrative.beatPurpose: Hook the audience with immediate danger; pose a mystery about how a simple art commission went wrong.
narrative.conflict: Unseen pursuers or consequences are chasing Jason.
narrative.stakes: His safety, career, and sense of trust in the commission process.
narrative.outcome: Scene ends unresolved; transitions to backstory.

continuityLinks: This scene pays off later when the consequences of the commission are revealed.
